How to Install ioport on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • ioport

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install ioport on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing ioport on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall ioport in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install ioport, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install ioport Using apt

To install ioport in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install ioport using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install ioport

The installation of ioport might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install ioport Using apt-get

To install ioport using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install ioport.

sudo apt-get -y install ioport

Install ioport Using Synaptic

To install ioport using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install ioport on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for ioport. This will display the ioport package in the package window, now to install ioport, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the ioport package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of ioport.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install ioport Using aptitude

To install ioport on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of ioport.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install ioport using the command aptitude install ioport.

sudo aptitude -y install ioport

How to Upgrade ioport on debian

If you want to upgrade the ioport package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade ioport using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade ioport to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade ioport.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade ioport sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade ioport

Upgrade ioport using Aptitude

To upgrade ioport using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade ioport.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade ioport

Upgrade ioport using Synaptic

To upgrade ioport using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for ioport, now right-click ioport, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade ioport just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall ioport on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall ioport from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just ioport, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove ioport

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of ioport

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of ioport you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge ioport

Remove ioport using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall ioport using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for ioport, right-click the ioport package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall ioport click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install ioport on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade ioport using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of ioport then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
